final_answer.precision_note: 3 s.f.; computed from 1.50 A, 30.0 min and Cu2+ + 2e- → Cu data.

method: Calculate charge passed: Q = I×t = 1.50 × 30.0 × 60 = 2700 C. Moles of electrons are n(e−) = Q/F = 2700 / 96 500 = 2.80×10^-2 mol e−. From Cu2+ +2e− → Cu, moles Cu = n(e−)/2 = 1.40×10^-2 mol. Mass deposited m = n(Cu)×63.55 = 0.889 g.
checks: If all electrons reached Cu2+, at most about 1.4×10^-2 mol Cu can be deposited.
Using 63.55 g mol-1 converts this to roughly 0.9 g, matching the final value.
